result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Restitution is set at $0.
- Defendant to pay court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
- Pay all supervision fees.
Consecutive to: consecutive to sentence in case #10CF4132 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No alcohol or illegal drugs.

- Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
- Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision.

- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm and body armor possession and voting.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions

Defendant Jonathan Williams in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Jonathan Williams in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  Oral amendment made to criminal complaint by the state.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Offer placed on the record by the state.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to sentence in case #10CF4132 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Restitution is set at $0.
- Defendant to pay court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
- Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision.
- Pay all supervision fees.
- Obtain/maintain full-time employment.
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- No alcohol or illegal drugs.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm and body armor possession and voting.  Defendant advised of appeal rights.

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Photographs.
Letters from family on behalf of the defendant, received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Order to Produce from Dodge Correctional,  Filed

Defendant Jonathan Williams in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Leah R. Thomas in court, defendant Jonathan Williams not in court, in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conference conducted.  Jury Trial date to convert to a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

State's Motion in Limine received and filed.
State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed.

Defendant Jonathan Williams in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conference held.  Parties are close to a possible resolution.   Parties requests another final pretrial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan Williams in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Jonathan Williams in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to Suppress Statement and Evidence proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Detective Mitchell Ward, City of Milwaukee Police Officer Brian Shull and City of Milwaukee Police Officer Nicholas Povolo.  State's exhibits 1A and 1B offered and received.   State rests.  Sworn for the Defense:  Janel Williams.  Defense exhibit 2 offered and received.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Arguments heard.  Defense motion to Suppress Statement and Evidence denied.  Parties request this matter be set for Final Pretrial and Jury Trial.  Witness list and Motion in Limine to be filed on/before the final pretrial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Amended Motion to Suppress Evidence and Statements received and filed.

Defendant Jonathan Williams in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Jonathan Williams in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mitchell Ward-MPD Officer. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #10CF4132 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
